Requesting the following information: 1. All documents, records, and materials relating in any way to Oxitec's proposed plan for the field release of their genetically engineered mosquito (Aedes aegypti OX513A) in Florida; 2. All documents, records, and materials submitted in support of and/or related to Oxitec' s Investigational New Animal Drug (INAD) file maintained by the Food & Drug Administration, including all application amendments and updates. This request encompasses, but is not limited to, the following: a. All documents, records, and materials concerning the articles used as components of Oxitec's mosquito, and the composition of Aedes aegypti OX513A, including the molecular characterization of the rDNA construct and the Aedes aegypti OX513A mosquito; b. All documents, records, and materials concerning the methods used in and the facilities and controls used for the containment and release of Aedes aegypti OX513A, including, but not limited to, plans and schematics for containment and release; c. Information concerning any samples of Aedes aegypti OX513A and its rDNA construct; and d. All documents, records, and materials concerning environmental analyse of potential individual and cumulative environmental effects, risks, and impacts associated with the release, escape or disposal of Oxitec' s Aedes aegypti OX513A, including, but not limited to, all documents related to an Environmental Assessment or Environmental Impact Statement created pursuant to 21 C.P.R.§§25, 514 and 42 U.S.C. § 4321 et seq.; 3. All documents, records, and materials (including inter-agency studies, memoranda and correspondence) related to the human health and environmental safety of Oxitec' s Aedes aegypti OX513A mosquito including, but not limited to, potential adverse outcomes; 4. All documents, records, and materials reflecting communication, including inter-agency studies, memoranda and correspondence, between the CDC and any other federal or state governmental agency or official concerning Oxitec's Aedes aegypti OX513A mosquito including, but not limited to, the U.S. Food & Drug Administration, the U.S. Department of Agriculture, the U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service, and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration; 5. All documents, records, and materials reflecting communication between the CDCe and other foreign governmental agency or official, including but not limited to officials of the United Kingdom, the Cayman Islands, and Malaysia concerning the field release of Oxitec's Aedes aegypti OX513A mosquito; 6. All documents, records, and materials reflecting communication, including inter-agency studies, memoranda and correspondence, between the CDC and Oxitec concerning 5. 6. Oxitec' s Aedes aegypti OX513A mosquito, including but not limited to communication I with Ms. Anne Kramer currently of Rectory Farmhouse, Ltd. on behalf of Oxitec; and 7. All documents, records, and materials indicating a plan or proposal to release Oxitec's Aedes aegypti OX513A mosquito in the state of Florida, or any other U.S. state or U.S. territory.

Requesting any information related to the exhibitor Hugo Liebel d/b/a the Florida State Family Circus (58-C-0288, Gust. No. 3203). The information sought includes, but is not limited to, any notes, memos or correspondence relating to the veterinary condition(s) of elephant Nosey. Specifically, requesting notes, memos or records relating to inspections of the elephants. Requesting notes, memos, records and correspondence relating to APHIS's response to all complaints concerning this exhibitor, including but not limited to IDA's complaints of August 22, 2011, and In Defense of Animals follow-up letter of September 30, 2011. Also, request notes, memos, records and correspondence addressing the issue of which members, if any, of the Liebel's family have the knowledge and experience required for handling dangerous wild animals in public and any written standards or guidelines used by APHIS in determining whether any handler has the requisite knowledge and experience for handling dangerous wild animals in public. In addition, requesting a copy of any itinerary filed with your agency as required, reflecting travel subsequent to September of 2011.
